stance_1: Doctor advised me to eat meat during pregnancy
justification: The doctor's advice to eat meat during pregnancy led the interviewee to end 19 years of vegetarianism, creating a direct conflict between the two stances.

stance_1: Doctor advised me to eat meat during pregnancy
stance_2: I eat red meat zero to two times a week
justification: The doctor's advice directly resulted in the interviewee resuming meat consumption, including red meat.

stance_1: Doctor advised me to eat meat during pregnancy
stance_2: I often don't eat any meat at all
justification: Doctor's advice to eat meat during pregnancy is in tension with the ongoing tendency to often not eat meat at all.

stance_1: Doctor advised me to eat meat during pregnancy
stance_2: I eat meat when I feel low on iron and B12
justification: Both are motivated by health needs, with the doctor's advice establishing a pattern of eating meat for nutritional deficiencies.

stance_2: I often don't eat any meat at all
justification: Craving chicken sometimes conflicts with often not eating any meat.

stance_1: I eat meat when I feel low on iron and B12
stance_2: I feel physically better after eating fish
justification: Eating meat for nutritional needs and feeling physically better after eating fish both reflect the supportive role of meat/fish for health.

stance_1: I eat meat when I feel low on iron and B12
stance_2: I feel mentally better after eating fish
justification: Eating meat for nutritional needs and feeling mentally better after fish both suggest perceived health benefits from meat/fish.

stance_1: I eat meat when I feel low on iron and B12
stance_2: I often don't eat any meat at all
justification: Eating meat when feeling low on iron/B12 conflicts with often not eating any meat at all.

stance_1: I eat red meat zero to two times a week
stance_2: I often don't eat any meat at all
justification: Eating red meat zero to two times a week conflicts with often not eating any meat at all.

stance_1: I feel mentally better after eating fish
stance_2: I feel physically better after eating fish
justification: The interviewee explicitly states that both physical and mental wellbeing improve after eating fish.

stance_2: I eat red meat zero to two times a week
justification: Being vegetarian for 19 years and now eating red meat are in direct conflict.

stance_2: I eat meat when I feel low on iron and B12
justification: Being vegetarian for 19 years is in tension with the current practice of eating meat for nutritional reasons.

stance_1: My husband eats the same way I do
stance_2: I eat red meat zero to two times a week
justification: The interviewee's husband eats the same way, supporting the interviewee's red meat consumption pattern.

stance_1: My husband eats the same way I do
stance_2: I often don't eat any meat at all
justification: The husband eating the same way supports the interviewee's habit of often not eating meat.
